newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico cattle report, feeder export price -USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexico cattle report, feeder export price -USDA.

text.p: USDA reported on Thursday that around 1,500 head were exported into the United States at one crossing point Wednesday.
The exports went through Santa Teresa, New Mexico, and were steers weighting between 300-800 lbs, USDA said.
"Majority of cattle traded weighed between 300-400 lb. The majority of feeders weighing 700-800 lb were previously sold on video," USDA said.
Prices for head weighing 300-400 lb were 100-110 cents/lb and for 400-500 lb head at 90-100 cents/lb. One lot of steers weighing over 700 lb sold at 80 cents/lb.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom +525 7289530)) E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com
